Title: Data/Research & Insights Analyst
Description:
SAMY Alliance is a digital marketing company specializing in advocacy marketing, influencer marketing, and content production. Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Madrid, SAMY Alliance operates in over 55 markets with offices in 18 countries and employs more than 500 people. The company focuses on providing integrated marketing solutions through research, data analytics, social media, digital content, and public relations. They work with prominent brands such as Danone, L'Oréal, Disney, Unilever, and Nestlé.




Mission




We are seeking a Data/Research & Insights Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role is critical in leveraging data to drive actionable insights, shaping innovative strategies, and optimizing campaign performance. The ideal candidate is analytical, curious, and skilled at uncovering trends that guide creative and strategic decision-making.




Job description




Data Analysis & Insights:

Translate large volumes of data into concise, impactful insights.
Analyze metrics to evaluate campaign performance, identifying trends and areas for optimization.
Develop and maintain benchmarks to measure success against industry standards and competitors.

Social Listening & Market Research:

Use social listening tools (e.g., Brandwatch, Sprinklr, Synthesio, NetBase, Socialbakers) to monitor consumer conversations, market trends, and competitor activity.
Conduct research to support account management and strategic planning teams with trend reports and market analysis.
Stay informed about the latest innovations and industry developments to guide strategy.

Reporting:

Prepare quarterly performance reports focused on brand performance, category trends, and competitive analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create actionable recommendations that inform content creation, campaign messaging, and budget optimization.




Skills & Qualifications:

Required Skills:

2 years of experience overall
Ability to translate complex datasets into meaningful insights and impactful reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Highly collaborative with excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Proactive, curious, and innovative mindset.
Languages: Italian native, English full working proficiency (written and verbal)




Experience:

Proven experience in using social listening tools and analyzing data for marketing strategies (minimum 2-3 years).
Expertise in query setup, keyword selection, and crafting data-driven reports tailored to specific brand strategies.
Familiarity with digital marketing trends, social media platforms, and influencer marketing metrics.




Benefits:

A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
Opportunities for professional growth and skill development.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
A chance to work with global brands and make a meaningful impact on their strategies.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst and Data Viz passionate – appartenente alle categorie protette della Lg. 68/99
Description:
“Torture the data, and it will confess to anything.”




Stiamo cercando “cacciatori di informazioni” appassionati, menti curiose in grado di “scavare nelle miniere” di dati e processi aziendali per ricavare intuizioni utili, Data Analyst per la nostra practice di Business Analytics & Intelligence.




Ti troverai in un ambiente amichevole e giovane, composto da statistici, ingegneri, data scientist e matematici, lavorando sia su linguaggi proprietari (SAS, Python, Qlik, Tableau, …) che open source per clienti che coprono tutti i principali settori aziendali.




Principali attività:

analisi e comprensione delle esigenze del Cliente
disegno e implementazione delle soluzioni tecniche che soddisfino i requisiti del Cliente
interrogazione e rappresentazione di dati, nell’ottica di comprendere e migliorare processi aziendali




Competenze e conoscenze richieste:

Laurea triennale o magistrale in Ingegneria/Informatica, Statistica, Matematica o altre discipline orientate ai dati
conoscenza del linguaggio SQL
gradita la conoscenza di uno o più tecnologie di analisi dati
buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
buone doti relazionali e analitiche
caratteristiche molto apprezzate sono la propensione all’innovazione e proattività




Costituirà titolo preferenziale l’appartenenza a categorie protette L68/69.

Title: Analyst
Description:
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions, and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. IQVIA creates intelligent connections across all aspects of healthcare through its analytics, transformative technology, big data resources and extensive domain expertise

IQVIA Connected Intelligence™ delivers powerful insights with speed and agility — enabling customers to accelerate the clinical development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments that improve healthcare outcomes for patients.

We are currently looking for two Analysts to join the Advanced Analytics practice of our Consulting team based in Milan.

As an Analyst within IQVIA’s Advanced Analytics practice, you will be responsible for actively participating in/supporting the development and delivery of projects with a specific focus on analytics by:



Extracting data from IQVIA data sources and, if needed, integrating them with Clients’ and/or Open Sources data
Performing advanced statistical analyses, exploiting also Machine Learning algorithms methodologies, to develop data-driven solutions for our Client (e.g. Segmentation & Profiling, ROI analyses, Test and Control analysis, Sales Forecasting, Markets evolution tracking, patients and sales split by indication, etc.) using IQVIA information platforms, statistical software or open source languages
Interpreting the results obtained from the analyses and making them clear and insightful for the Client
Taking responsibility for creating reports, presentations and other deliverables, directly being exposed to client’s interactions
Gaining experience in coding to manipulate and analyze regular and big data set


Desired Skills And Experience


MSc degree with strong record of academic achievement, preferably in Economics, Statistics or Business
Minimum 6 months to 2 years of experience in similar analytical roles, preferably in Consulting organizations or pharma company
Strong analytic and quantitative background
Demonstrated ability to use programming language like Python or R or statistical software like SAS
Ability to analyze complex data, draw conclusions, generate insights, summarize recommendations
Excellent Microsoft Office Skills: strong skills in working with Excel spreadsheets and creating presentations with Power Point
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Excellent problem-solving, organizational and time-management abilities
Proficiency in English, Italian is a must.
Proven team-work experience


What we offer:



Career Development opportunities: at IQVIA, the company that can be defined as the University of Healthcare, we are committed to hiring exceptional talents and helping employees reach their professional goals through Internal Job Opportunities, structured Performance Management and Enablement processes, Mentoring program, Diversity&Inclusion initiatives and much more!
Competitive Benefits: You can invest in you and your family's well-being applying to the Employee Assistance Program, you will have an interesting Insurance Plan and 20% discount on your public transportation annual subscription. You can use a flexible benefits budget for a wide selection of services (wellness, culture, education, etc). Apply and find out more!
Flexibility: You have flexible working conditions, we trust our employees and we believe that we can perform our job in a smart/agile way, but you can rely also on a modern and sustainable office (LEED Platinum certified!) where you can meet other colleagues, collaborate, innovate and having fun!
Unparalleled opportunity to play an active role in helping create a healthier world. Our work is important. It's challenging. Improving human health requires brave thinkers who are willing to explore new ideas, build on successes, and learn from mistakes. It takes brave minds to bring powerful ideas to reality and transform healthcare. We are a diverse, global team that shares a passion for collaboration and solving complex problems. Together, we help customers drive healthcare forward. Join IQVIA and see where your skills can take you.


Location: Milan – Hybrid formula

Permanent contract

IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Analista ESG – Dati e Reporting - STAGE
Description:
Iper, La grande i,

Azienda italiana leader della Distribuzione Moderna Organizzata (DMO), ricerca per la propria sede di Milano (MI) un/a Analista ESG – Dati e Reporting in STAGE

Posizione:

Il Gruppo Finiper Canova è alla ricerca di un/una Analista ESG in STAGE per supportare il team nella gestione dei dati ESG, nell’analisi e nella reportistica.

La figura si occuperà, in supporto ai colleghi, di analizzare e monitorare le performance ESG aziendali, supportando anche la gestione di progetti legati alla sostenibilità.

Responsabilità:


Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati ESG per misurare le performance aziendali e identificare opportunità di miglioramento.
Supportare la redazione dei report ESG (ad esempio, Bilancio di Sostenibilità, reporting GRI, TCFD, ecc.) per stakeholder interni ed esterni.
Garantire l'accuratezza e l'affidabilità dei dati ESG, collaborando con altri dipartimenti per ottenere le informazioni necessarie.
Supportare la gestione di progetti di sostenibilità, come iniziative di economia circolare, efficienza energetica o engagement dei dipendenti.
Monitorare e aggiornare il team sulle evoluzioni normative e sugli standard di settore legati alla rendicontazione ESG.
Contribuire alla creazione di dashboard e strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati per comunicare in modo chiaro e trasparente le prestazioni ESG.
Partecipare alla promozione di una cultura della sostenibilità all'interno dell’organizzazione.

Requisiti:


Laurea in Economia, Scienze Ambientali, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
Buona conoscenza degli standard di reporting ESG (es. GRI, SASB, TCFD) e dei nuovi indicatori ESRS previsti dalla CSRD.
Eccellenti capacità analitiche, con padronanza di strumenti come Excel, Power BI o altri software di analisi dati.
Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli, con capacità organizzative e di gestione documentale.
Ottime capacità comunicative, scritte e orali, con predisposizione al lavoro in team.

Esperienza di 1 anno in ambito ESG, sostenibilità o analisi dei dati (anche attraverso stage o tirocini) verrà considerata un plus.

Altre informazioni:

La selezione è rivolta a candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso ai sensi del D. Lgs. 198/2006. Tutte le candidature devono essere accompagnate dalla autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali e saranno gestite ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo 2016/679 ( c.d. GDPR).

Per ulteriori informazioni circa le opportunità professionali ed il mondo di Iper, La grande i diventa follower della nostra pagina Linkedin (click su "Segui" al link https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/152414/)

Title: Junior Power BI
Description:
Proxima è un gruppo di aziende con skill funzionali e tecnologiche innovative, che mettono a fattor comune la propria esperienza in un’offerta congiunta di sviluppo di soluzioni all’interno della nostra Software Factory. Offriamo consulenza e servizi di Application Management e Quality Assurance.

Chi cerchiamo?

Junior Power BI

Dove e come?

Milano, ibrido

Di cosa ti occuperai?

Gestione di pipeline ETL in Databricks utilizzando SQL e Python, con sviluppo di Job per l'aggiornamento dei dati.

Sviluppo di report e dashboard in Power BI Desktop e Power BI Service

Analisi dei requisiti di business per implementare report su Power BI utili al monitoraggio dell’integrazione dei sistemi IT

Attività di Analisi Funzionale in progetti complessi e multi-stakeholder

Hai queste competenze?

Ottima conoscenza di SQL e Python

Esperienza nell’utilizzo di Databricks per la gestione dei flussi ETL

Competenza nello sviluppo e nella gestione di report e dashboard con Power BI

Conoscenza delle metodologie di analisi funzionale e capacità di tradurre requisiti di business in soluzioni tecniche

Sei il candidato ideale se...

Sei orientato/a alla gestione del cliente

Hai capacità relazionali e predisposizione al lavoro in team

Possiedi attitudine al problem solving

Sei orientato/a al risultato e alla qualità delle soluzioni

Cosa offriamo?

R.A.L. commisurata alla seniority

BUONI PASTO (anche in modalità full remote)

ASSICURAZIONE SANITARIA CON COPERTURA INTEGRATIVA

I nostri benefit

PERCORSI DI CARRIERA

Abbiamo un articolato sistema di valutazione delle competenze e misurazione delle performance che consente al dipendente di crescere insieme a noi.

FORMAZIONE PROFESSIONALIZZANTE

Offriamo percorsi di formazione e di aggiornamento professionale con taglio tecnico/pratico su tematiche in ambito ICT. Ogni famiglia tecnologica ha uno o più ICT trainer di riferimento, che, lavorando in piena sinergia con l’area HR, valuta e propone percorsi di formazione continua customizzati sulla crescita professionale di ogni dipendente.

SCONTI E PROMOZIONI RISERVATE

Abbiamo stabilito degli accordi con delle piattaforme per riservare ai nostri dipendenti scontistica e promozioni esclusive.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto a entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: STAGE - Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Chi è ENGIE

ENGIE mette al centro delle sue attività (elettricità, gas naturale, efficientamento energetico e servizi) lo sviluppo sostenibile, per far fronte alle sfide della transizione energetica verso una low carbon economy: accesso ad un'economia sostenibile, mitigazione e adattamento al cambiamento climatico e ottimizzazione delle risorse.




Chi cerchiamo

Una risorsa da inserire presso la nostra sede di Milano nell’ambito della Global Business Unit Retail.

La Global Business Unit RETAIL è focalizzata sulla vendita delle commodity ai clienti finali e sull’installazione e manutenzione di caldaie ad uso domestico su gran parte del territorio nazionale con un importante obiettivo di crescita.

Nel 2022 conta oltre 1 milione di clienti per l’energia e i servizi.

La digitalizzazione, i servizi 2.0 e le soluzioni green rappresentano le strategie che la GBU Retail intende incrementare.




Che cosa farai?

Riporterai al Senior Customer Data Expert e, in coordinamento con il team di Customer Value & Strategy e il team Marketing, supporterai le attività di analisi, reporting e data governance.




Quali saranno le tue responsabilità?

Supportare la creazione e manutenzione di report per il monitoraggio dei principali KPI relativi al valore e alle caratteristiche fondamentali del portafoglio clienti come il churn, l’engagement e la digitalizzazione
Effettuare analisi regolari sui dati del settore utilities, generando insight per supportare le decisioni aziendali relative al valore del cliente
Supportare la gestione e manutenzione dei framework e dei processi di Data Governance per garantire la qualità, la coerenza e la sicurezza dei dati
Aiutare a standardizzare i processi di reporting per garantire coerenza tra le diverse unità aziendali
Lavorare a stretto contatto con le parti interessate aziendali per raccogliere requisiti e fornire insight utili




Che cosa porterai in ENGIE?

Laurea in Scienze Economiche, Economia, Statistica, Ingegneria Gestionale o in un campo correlato (preferibilmente prossimi alla laurea o neolaureati)
Esperienza di base in analisi dei dati e reporting (tirocini, progetti universitari o esperienze simili)
Familiarità con strumenti di analisi dei dati come Excel Tableau e/o Power BI
Forti capacità analitiche, attenzione ai dettagli e capacità di interpretare dati complessi
Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese




Perché scegliere ENGIE?

Lavorare in ENGIE, gruppo multinazionale, significa avere un'ampia varietà di possibilità di carriera in oltre 30 paesi.

Ma significa anche mettere la comunità al centro della tua vita professionale e contribuire a un vero cambiamento nel corso di una carriera stimolante.

Il nostro impegno è chiaro: sosteniamo un modello sociale che concilia la performance economica con l'impatto positivo sulle persone e sul pianeta. Scommettiamo sul potere della collettività e agiamo come parte di una comunità impegnata a sconvolgere e reinventare il futuro. Diversità e inclusione sono al centro della nostra cultura aziendale.

ENGIE si impegna a combattere tutte le forme di discriminazione in materia di occupazione, accesso alla formazione e promozione. Pertanto, l'integrazione e il sostegno di giovani, adulti, persone con disabilità, senza alcuna distinzione di genere, etnia o religione, sono priorità fondamentali della politica delle risorse umane.

Le Certificazioni EDGE e UNI PDR 125/22 conquistate, dimostrano tale impegno.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
For Choreograph, the global data and technology business unit in GroupM, we are looking for a Data Analysis Intern.

Key Activities:


Requirements Analysis Support: Assist in translating business needs into technical and analytical requirements.
Research and Development (R&D) Support: Contribute to R&D efforts for developing analytical solutions and addressing technical challenges.
Requirements Gathering and Project Scope Definition Support: Assist in gathering requirements and defining project scope, contributing to data analysis.
Communication: Maintain clear and consistent communication, both verbal and written, to understand data needs and report findings.
Project Management Support: Support project management to ensure timely and accurate delivery, assisting with communication on project status with team members.
Data Modeling and Statistical Support: Apply data modeling and statistical principles to analyze datasets, supporting the generation of strategic insights.


About You:


Analytical Skills: Understanding of analytical methods and interest in modeling and algorithms.
Technical Skills: Basic knowledge of SQL, Python, R, and/or other analytical tools. Willingness to learn and develop skills.
Data Visualization: Familiarity with data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Statistical Knowledge: Good analytical skills and basic statistical background.
Data Management: Interest in managing and manipulating datasets.
Communication Skills: Ability to communicate effectively.
Microsoft Excel: Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.


Plus:


Being curious about data
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform
Experience with Consumer Data Platforms or Data Management Platforms
Knowledge of the media advertising ecosystem, especially TV advertising, with a basic understanding of ad inventory and monetization.


LOCATION

Wpp Campus in Milan ( plus the option for hybrid working)

We are proud to have a team made up of individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that this diversity is a strength . This position is also dedicated to people belonging to Categorie Protette ex l. 68/99

Title: Junior Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Stiamo cercando un/a 📯 Data Analytics Consultant Junior 📯!

La risorsa che cerchiamo è motivata e desiderosa di apprendere, con una forte passione per l'analisi dei dati e le tecnologie cloud.

🏁 Responsabilità principali:


Supportare il team nella configurazione di pipeline di dati utilizzando Azure Data Factory.
Eseguire analisi e query su database utilizzando T-SQL.
Collaborare allo sviluppo di modelli tabulari per la visualizzazione dei dati in Power BI.
Supportare nell’ottimizzazione dei processi ETL e nella creazione di report.
Partecipare ad attività di formazione interna per sviluppare competenze su Azure e strumenti correlati.



La risorsa sarà guidata da un team esperto per acquisire competenze su piattaforme avanzate come Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, e modelli Tabular con Power BI e/o Analysis Services.

👌 Requisiti


Laurea (o in fase di conseguimento) in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini.
Conoscenza base e interesse per il linguaggio T-SQL.
Familiarità o interesse per Python per la manipolazione e analisi dei dati.
Buone capacità di problem-solving e propensione all’apprendimento.
Esperienza minima (anche stage) in ambito dati o analisi è considerata un plus.



💞 da noi troverai:


ambiente di lavoro giovane, dinamico e stimolante;
supporto nella tua crescita professionale con una formazione continua;
possibilità di lavorare in modalità ibrida;



📍 sede di lavoro: Sesto San Giovanni (MI)

🏡 pattern di lavoro: ibrido (2-3 gg di smart working a settimana)

In Relatech promuoviamo una cultura inclusiva e rispettosa di ognuno, che permetta a tutti di mostrare a pieno il proprio potenziale e godere di una carriera soddisfacente.

Valorizziamo lo spirito di iniziativa, la creatività e la passione.

Il nostro obiettivo è formare e trattenere le persone migliori per fornire soluzioni innovative.

La nostra politica di flessibilità garantisce la modalità lavorativa in smart-working e uno stile di vita orientato al work life balance.

Assumiamo persone qualificate senza distinzioni di sesso, etnia, disabilità, età, stato civile e orientamento sessuale, religioso e politico.

Il Gruppo Relatech S.p.A. presta attenzione alle risorse appartenenti alle categorie protette, ai sensi degli articoli 1 e 18 della legge 68 del ‘99.

I dati personali saranno trattati in conformità alle disposizioni contenute nel regolamento UE 2016/679.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Lifesciences Consultants is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Junior HR Data Analyst to join our Team. This role will focus on supporting HR operations and analytics, particularly in generating data reports and monitoring internal processes.




Key Responsibilities

- Data Reporting & Analysis: assist in preparing and maintaining HR data reports.

- Administrative Support: maintain HR databases and records, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.

- Collaboration: work closely with HR Team and Managers to gather data and support plans’ development; provide status updates.

- Process Improvement: help streamline HR operations by identifying inefficiencies and recommending improvements.




Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics or related field.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data management tools.

- Strong organizational and multitasking skills.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- High attention to detail and ability to work with sensitive information.

- Prior experience in the role is a plus.




What We Offer

- Opportunity for professional growth and development.

- A collaborative and supportive work environment.

- Exposure to diverse HR functions and hands-on experience.

Show more

- Data Reporting & Analysis: assist in preparing and maintaining HR data reports.

- Administrative Support: maintain HR databases and records, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.

- Collaboration: work closely with HR Team and Managers to gather data and support plans’ development; provide status updates.

- Process Improvement: help streamline HR operations by identifying inefficiencies and recommending improvements.


Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics or related field.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data management tools.

- Strong organizational and multitasking skills.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- High attention to detail and ability to work with sensitive information.

- Prior experience in the role is a plus.


What We Offer

- Opportunity for professional growth and development.

- A collaborative and supportive work environment.

- Exposure to diverse HR functions and hands-on experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Choreograph is the global data and technology business unit in GroupM. It unifies the data, analytics, technology consulting, and technology expertise across the GroupM network in a dedicated unit that enhances data and analytics services and deploy best-in-class media planning, activation, and measurement tool and methodologies.

We are looking for a Data Ananlyst to join our Measurement team, composed by 22 Consultants. The team is young, talented, and dynamic.

The candidate will work closely with both internal WPP/GroupM Agencies and external clients on business with the aim to provide strategic and tactical insight in order to optimize marketing investments and maximize ROI.

Responsibilities


Measure and analyze impact of marketing activities on client business goals
Analyze different type of metrics like business data, macro-economic dynamics, web analytics, media and marketing investments, promotion, call center data and other relevant factors
Develop Marketing Mix Models, Regression Based Attribution Models, Multi-touch Attribution and other analytical solutions to provide data driven recommendation supporting media investment allocation and planning
Evaluate different Marketing and Media Scenarios, forecasting business results and supporting marketing strategy
Manage the relationships with internal and external stakeholders, to lead the whole analysis process, from data collection up to final presentation and discussion with the client
Design and develop performance reports, defining the Key metrics & actionable insight


About You


A curious and data-oriented mindset, with economic-mathematic-statistic background
Strong analytical skills set and problem solving
Excellent communication and presentation skills, combined with the ability to collaborate across teams
Strong interest for the interpretation of business data
Excel and PowerPoint proficient
Knowledge of the English language
Have a strong orientation toward team working, collaboration and support of colleagues, while always maintaining a positive approach
3+ years of working experience


The knowledge of the following will be considered as a plus:


Previous experience with Marketing Mix Modeling/Econometric Modeling
BI tools like PowerBI, Data Studio, Tableau, QlikView
Python/R/Sql/Google Cloud Platform/Scripting Skills
Previous experience in a Consulting/Analytic Roles


LOCATION

WPP Campus in Milan (plus the option for hybrid working).

We are proud to have a team made up of individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that this diversity is a strength. This position is also open to individuals belonging to Categorie Protette under Law 68/99.


Show more

Title: Junior - Data Analyst - Audit
Description:
Junior - Data Analyst - Assurance

Sei pronto a #MakeAnImpactThatMatters nel nostro team Audit & Assurance?

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Assurance Advisory avrai l’occasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe più esperte, sarai responsabile delle attività progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualità del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorità, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.

Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realtà leader nel settore.

Come verrai inserito in azienda?

I candidati e le candidate parteciperanno ad un percorso di selezione nel quale avranno la possibilità di mettersi alla prova attraverso giornate di assessment, con l’obiettivo di valorizzare competenze e potenzialità personali.

Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva.

#YourRole

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilità di imparare dai colleghi più Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.

In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di


Analisi dati su basi dati relazionali e NoSQL
Utilizzo di strumenti quali SQL, Qlik, Excel, Python, Power Platform
Sviluppo e mantenimento di progetti di Data Analytics (DataBase, ETL, Reportistica)
Utilizzo dei tipici tool quali Visual Studio, Sql Server Management Studio.


Grazie all’ufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attività di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

#WinningRequirements


Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Data Science
Spiccate capacità analitiche e attitudine al problem solving
Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
Propensione al lavoro in team
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Ottime capacità relazionali e comunicative.
#NiceToHave
Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza uno fra: SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, Power Apps


#LoveWorkingAtDeloitteIf


Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d’ordine è: crescita
L’idea di trasformare un problema in opportunità ti stimola
Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d’insieme, tenendo sempre a mente l’operatività per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrità e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorità possono cambiare quotidianamente
Ami lavorare in team
#MakeanImpactThatMatters


Siamo impegnati a ridurre i nostri impatti e incoraggiamo le persone ad assumere comportamenti sostenibili. Per salvaguardare l’ambiente e limitare il climate change, abbiamo sviluppato la strategia WorldClimate, attraverso la quale ci siamo posti l’obiettivo di diventare una Net Zero.

Join our #iAct movement! Fai il quiz per calcolare la tua carbon footprint e scopri come adottare dei comportamenti più responsabili.

Se vuoi scoprire come sarà il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.

Se vuoi prepararti ad incontrare i nostri Recruiter iscriviti alla nostra piattaforma gratuita di orientamento al lavoro.

Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano, Cagliari, Roma.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst | MILANO
Description:
Descrizione azienda

Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.

Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!

Posizione

Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.

Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.

Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.

Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?

Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti.

Come?


realizzando report su misura;
utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);
sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;
collaborando con i colleghi del team.



Requisiti

Sei tu la persona giusta?

Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.

In più è fantastico se…


ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;
Excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;
hai una conoscenza base di PowerBI ed SQL;
ti entusiasma lavorare in team;
sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità;



Altre informazioni

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Show more

  • Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
  • Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
  • Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS

  • You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
  • You have an analytical mindset.
  • You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
  • You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
  • You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
  • You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.


You get even more bonus points if …

  • You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
  • You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
  • You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER

  • We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
  • Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …


Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join Revpanda.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data related to revenue, client, player behavior, registrations, FTD (First-Time Depositors), payback, and marketing efforts. Your insights will support strategic decisions and optimize our marketing and operational strategies.







Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, process, and analyze data from various sources, including player behavior, registration, FTD, payback, and marketing and financial campaigns.
Reporting & Dashboards: Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Insights & Recommendations: Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data, providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve business outcomes.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, product development, and operational teams to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights.
Market Analysis: Conduct market and competitor analysis to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
Data Integrity: Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and validation processes.
Visualization: Create clear and effective data visualizations to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.







Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the iGaming, digital marketing, or related industries.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and iGaming industry trends.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
Experience with A/B testing and data-driven experimentation.




What we offer:

Friendly and supportive colleagues
Diverse opportunities for professional growth and career development
Possibility to take part in international conferences and online courses
Competitive salary
Birthday day off
"Refer a friend" bonus
Corporate events
LinkedIn Learning complimentary access

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst with experience in the Insurance sector?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for a “Data Solution Lead” to join a leading pharmaceutical company based in Belgium. As the Data Solution Lead, you will be responsible for gathering relevant information related to physical assets in order to analyse them and make appropriate, fact-based decisions.




KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Your duties as the Solution Lead will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:

1. Identify business needs, translate them into analyst requirements, and transform them into reports.

2. Communicate and simplify technical language for stakeholders, guiding them through new concepts such as data owner, data steward, and life cycle.

3. Identify necessary data and display it in comprehensive reports.

4. Conduct technical assessments and identify potential risks.




ROLE REQUIREMENTS:

To be successful in your application to this exciting role as the Data Solution Lead, we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:

1. Relevant degree in a related field.

2. Extensive industry experience in a similar role.

3. A working knowledge and practical experience with SAP analysis, problem-solving, and data analytics.

4. Knowledge of Power BI




Key Words:

Solution Lead / Pharmaceutical / Data Analysis / SAP / Technical Assessments / Risk Identification / Business Needs / Data Steward / Data Owner / Power BI / Hybrid Role




Hyper Recruitment Solutions Ltd (HRS) is an Equal Opportunities employer. We welcome applications from anyone who meets the role requirements. HRS exclusively supports the STEM sectors, combining recruitment expertise with scientific knowledge to help you advance your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
I am currently searching for an experienced freelance Data Analyst to join an exciting client of mine based in Brussels




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in analysing, interpreting, and transforming data into meaningful insights that inform the decision-making processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, and operations, to support strategic initiatives and help them meet their business objectives. This position requires a detail-oriented individual with strong analytical skills and an ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support project goals.
Create insightful reports, dashboards, and visualizations to track project performance and KPIs.
Identify trends, anomalies, and actionable insights to support decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Present findings and data-driven recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and integrity across all analysis processes.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst (freelance experience preferred).
Proficiency in data analysis tools like SQL, Python, or R.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex insights to a non-technical audience.




Fluent in Dutch or French and English.




The Offer:

Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Opportunity to collaborate with a dynamic and supportive team.
A chance to work on diverse and impactful projects.
Start date ASAP




If you are interested in this position, Please Apply Now !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Roles & Responsibilities




Our client in the private banking sector is looking for a Data Analyst to join their dynamic IT squad. The team consists of two developers and two analysts working collaboratively on data and digital projects. They leverage cutting-edge technology to deliver innovative solutions in asset management, partnering closely with business colleagues to provide high-quality services for both internal stakeholders and external institutional clients. The team is young, hands-on, and dedicated to achieving exceptional results.







Your Missions:




Act as a bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Understand and document stakeholder business requirements.
Conduct thorough analysis to define functional requirements that align with business objectives.
Engage with various departments to gather input and ensure alignment.
Create detailed documentation, including user stories, use cases, and functional specifications.
Collaborate closely with developers to clarify requirements and ensure accurate software design.
Develop test plans, write test cases, and perform functional testing to ensure quality.







Profile




At least 2 years of experience in software development as a business, functional or test analyst.
Strong foundation in writing use cases and business requirements, process modeling, SQL and overall testing knowledge.
Knowledge of JIRA, Confluence, TestRail, Postman, DBeaver.
English fluency, both written and spoken, is an absolute must.
Knowledge of the financial services industry, particularly asset management, is a significant advantage.
Knowledge of Data Warehousing is a plus




Soft Skills: Pro-active & autonomous, Hands-on, Problem-solver, Team player




Offer




• Start date: ASAP.

• Homeworking: 2 days per week and 3 days in the Brussels office.




Interested? Join our team of experts and become a pillar of our success in the banking and insurance sector. Apply now to start a rewarding adventure at DynaFin.







About Dynafin Consulting




DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 200 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest – Payments – Credits – Insurance – Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.

Title: Risk Data Analyst
Description:
Le business des produits financiers (leasing, crédits, assurances) vous intéresse ?

Le secteur automobile et les défis futurs de la mobilité vous passionnent?

Vous avez déjà une première expérience dans le monde financier ?

Vous recherchez un nouveau défi et vous désirez exercer un job vous permettant d’exploiter pleinement vos talents en matière d'analyse financière ?

Dans ce cas vous êtes peut-être notre futur(e) collègue !




Stellantis Financial Services est la société financière des marques Peugeot, Citroën et DS, Opel , Fiat, Alpha Romeo,Abarth, Fiat Professional, Jeep, Maserati, construite en Joint-Venture avec la Banque Santander et présente dans plus de 10 pays Européens.

Nous proposons une large gamme de produits de financement dédiés à la mobilité : leasing, renting, crédits, assurances, ainsi que toute une gamme de services associés.

Nous accompagnons le développement des ventes de véhicules de nos marques via notre réseau de distribution.

(*) Stellantis est devenu le 4ème groupe mondial dans le secteur automobile et rassemble 14 marques automobiles




Votre fonction :

Création, analyse , communication et présentation des rapports en interne ainsi qu’en externe.
Plan d’action pour résoudre les problèmes liés aux diverses activités de la banque.
Communication aux autres services des risques liés à leur activité.
Contrôle de la performance de toutes les activités d’un point de vue risque même si celles-ci ne sont pas en lien direct avec le risque.
Production des chiffres des clôtures mensuelles.
Création du budget.
Réalisation des prévisions fin de mois
Piloter le risque de la banque et contrôler la performance vis-à-vis du budget .
Participation à la mise en place des différents projets liés au Risk.
Relation avec les audits internes et externes.
Responsable du risque opérationnel et polyvalence avec les autres fonctions du risque
Effectuer le traitement, l'exploitation et intégration des données dans un data warehouse (SAS)




Votre profil :

Master en ingénierie ou en mathématique
Excellente connaissance d'Excel
Connaissance du programme SAS souhaitée
Travailler sous la pression des délais
Equilibre entre esprit d'équipe et autonomie
Bilinguisme français-anglais




Nous vous proposons :

Travailler chez Stellantis Financial Services , c’est intégrer une société à taille humaine, mais aussi un groupe leader dans le secteur automobile, qui vous offre l’opportunité de de vous épanouir professionnellement et développer vos talents




Un environnement de travail centré sur l’automobile mais aussi la finance
Un environnement de type PME : familial, convivial, circuit de communication court, managers d’équipe accessibles et disponibles.
Un package complet avec avantages extra-légaux tels que chèque-repas, assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation…
6 jours de réduction de temps de travail sur base annuelle.
La possibilité de rejoindre des petites équipes soudées, motivées et compétentes qui favoriseront votre apprentissage et votre intégration.
Une évolution de carrière possible au sein des groupe SFS et Santander.
De nouveaux bureaux situés à Haren/Bruxelles avec parking et facilement accessibles en transport en commun

HTML:
Le business des produits financiers (leasing, crédits, assurances) vous intéresse ?

Le secteur automobile et les défis futurs de la mobilité vous passionnent?

Vous avez déjà une première expérience dans le monde financier ?

Vous recherchez un nouveau défi et vous désirez exercer un job vous permettant d’exploiter pleinement vos talents en matière d'analyse financière ?

Dans ce cas vous êtes peut-être notre futur(e) collègue !


Stellantis Financial Services est la société financière des marques Peugeot, Citroën et DS, Opel , Fiat, Alpha Romeo,Abarth, Fiat Professional, Jeep, Maserati, construite en Joint-Venture avec la Banque Santander et présente dans plus de 10 pays Européens.

Nous proposons une large gamme de produits de financement dédiés à la mobilité : leasing, renting, crédits, assurances, ainsi que toute une gamme de services associés.

Nous accompagnons le développement des ventes de véhicules de nos marques via notre réseau de distribution.

(*) Stellantis est devenu le 4ème groupe mondial dans le secteur automobile et rassemble 14 marques automobiles


Votre fonction :

  • Création, analyse , communication et présentation des rapports en interne ainsi qu’en externe.

  • Responsable du risque opérationnel et polyvalence avec les autres fonctions du risque
  • Effectuer le traitement, l'exploitation et intégration des données dans un data warehouse (SAS)


Votre profil :

  • Master en ingénierie ou en mathématique

  • Connaissance du programme SAS souhaitée
  • Travailler sous la pression des délais
  • Equilibre entre esprit d'équipe et autonomie

Travailler chez Stellantis Financial Services , c’est intégrer une société à taille humaine, mais aussi un groupe leader dans le secteur automobile, qui vous offre l’opportunité de de vous épanouir professionnellement et développer vos talents

Title: Analyst
HTML:
Job Description

About this job

Global Client Delivery is a modern service team transforming the way we serve our clients with new and updated tools to help our teams get the job done quickly and easily. We are the team that partners with clients to fuse data, science, and the talents of our people to provide measurement and improvement for the clients and markets we serve.

We are the key link between NielsenIQ and our retail partners from the FMCG industry.In this role, the Analytical Consultant will execute projects by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data and constructing presentations.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze and interpret sales data and consumer data;
  • Summarize data in tables, charts, and graphs;
  • Build a story line (category overview as well as issue-based analysis), draft presentations, draw conclusions, and propose recommendations (E2E process);
  • Deliver final presentations and present recommendations to clients;
  • Attend client meetings and presentations over the phone and in-person;
  • Discuss analytical design to manage clients’ expectations;
  • Learn how to incorporate Quantified Business Opportunities to make recommendations actionable

About You

For this business crucial role, you will have to possess strong relationship building and stakeholder management skills. You are a team player - orientated to details and an analytical approach will make you successful in the analytical part of the job. It is key to have the ability to draw conclusions and visualize a lot of data points in a simplified way. For the client-facing part, excellent presentation and communication skills are key, combined with being a good listener to understand what our clients really need and want from our data and NielsenIQ as a provider.

Qualifications

  • Professional experience in FMCG/retail is not a must, but strongly appreciated;
  • Business English knowledge, both verbal and written;
  • Fluent Dutch or French language skills;
  • Advanced analytical skills;
  • Good communication skills & visualization skills – interested in storytelling techniques;
  • Comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment;
  • Ability to work within a virtual environment;
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and other apps in the Office 365 suite;
  • Organizational & interpersonal skills;
  • Interest in the commercial industry

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Supporting all Franchises (Medical Care / Dermo-Cosmetics & Personal Care), the Data Analyst is a key Business Partner for the General Management. The position is based in Brussels.

The role reports to the Benelux General Manager.





Main Responsibilitie

sData analysis and reporting
:Maintain and update existing dashboards (weekly and monthly) to ensure stakeholders have real-time access to key business metrics
.Improve, simplify, standardize, and automate existing dashboards, reports, and KPIs
.Identify inefficiencies in reporting processes and propose innovative solutions for improvement
.Ideally, leverage scripting (e.g., Python, SQL) to streamline data extraction, transformation, and automation of manual processes
.Business Development Support
:Collaborate closely with stakeholders to monitor and enhance brand/portfolio performance (e.g., market share, sell-in/sell-out analysis)
.Analyze channel performance, providing insights into the effectiveness of various sales and marketing channels (pharmacies, e-commerce, direct-to-consumer)
.Ad hoc and Corporate Projects
:Act as the go-to analytical resource for ad hoc requests from sales and marketing teams
.Design and develop new dashboards to meet evolving needs, using advanced tools like Tableau
.Collaborate with HQ and business teams to ensure data accuracy, proper integration of systems, and alignment of analytics initiatives with business goals




.
Profi

leEducation : Master’s degree in data analytics, statistics, business engineering, computer science, or a related technical fiel
d;Languages : Fluent in French and English; knowledge of Dutch is a plu
s;Strong proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI
);Proficient in Microsoft Office, with advanced Excel skill
s;Knowledge of ERP systems (preferably Dynamics AX) and CRM platforms (preferably VEEVA
);Familiarity with ETL tools and processes such as Altery
x;Ideally knowledge of SQL for database querying; experience with scripting languages such as Pytho
n;Strong problem-solving skills, with a proactive and solution-oriented mindse
t;Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in data handling and reportin
g;Excellent interpersonal skills and team playe
r;Highly organized and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environmen
t;Stress resistant, ability to meet and establish tight deadline
s;Problem-solver with “can-do” mentality, able to both pragmatically define solutions and capture and understand all relevant details when necessar
y;Ability to analyze vast amounts of dat
a;Ability to see the big picture while focusing on the process and procedures necessary to produce deliverable




s;

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
JUNIOR DATA ENGINEER

Ter uitbreiding van ons team zijn wij op zoek naar een Junior Data Engineer.


Wat verwachten wij van jou?

  • Je bent analytisch ingesteld en een nauwkeurige werker;
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van het MS Office pakket, voornamelijk Excel;
  • Kennis van SQL is een must;
  • Eerdere ervaring met een BI/rapporteringstool (voorkeur voor Qlik Sense/Qlikview) vormt een grote plus;
  • Enige kennis van boekhouding komt ook van pas;
  • Je bent bereid om bij te leren, zowel inhoudelijk als technisch:
  • Werking van een gerechtsdeurwaarder en boekhouding;
  • Qlik Sense software;
  • Je spreekt vlot Nederlands;
  • Je bent sterk in probleemoplossend denken;
  • Je hebt een groot gevoel voor humor.

Wat kun jij van ons verwachten?

  • Je komt terecht in een groeiende project omgeving waar er een informele cultuur heerst en waar elke stem telt;
  • Een goede work/life balance staat hoog in ons vaandel, hybride werken is vanzelfsprekend na de inwerkperiode;
  • We organiseren op regelmatige basis leuke (sportieve) challenges, cafébezoekjes, onze jaarlijkse teambuilding, en andere toffe activiteiten;
  • Ook in jouw opleiding investeren we graag!

Nieuwsgierig geworden? Stuur dan je motivatiebrief en CV naar mve@kasparsolutions.be

Title: Data & Information analyst
Description:
Role Overview




As a Senior Information Analyst, you will focus on information and data analysis within the Policy Administration System and across related systems, such as financial systems, CRM, and POM (Payment Operations Management). This role includes analyzing production data, ensuring alignment with business rules, and supporting operational and project-based initiatives.




You will play a critical role in analyzing outputs such as tax sheets, broker commissions, and similar data, ensuring accuracy and compliance with business requirements.




Key Responsibilities




Data Analysis and Validation

Analyze and validate production data (e.g., tax sheets, broker commissions) against business-defined rules and standards.
Compare outputs with expected results, identify discrepancies, and propose corrective actions.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights to the business.




Information & Systems Analysis

Evaluate and improve data flows within the Policy Administration System and between other integrated systems (e.g., financial systems, CRM, POM).
Support incident management by assessing data-related issues, troubleshooting root causes, and facilitating resolutions.
Analyze system outputs to ensure accuracy, completeness, and alignment with business processes.




Business Support

Collaborate with business teams to address queries related to annual works, reports, and operational data.
Support stakeholders in understanding data analysis results and their impact on business operations.




Project Involvement

Contribute to large-scale projects, focusing on system integrations and data analysis.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance across multiple systems and project streams.




Collaboration and Agile Practices

Work within an Agile scrum team consisting of analysts, developers, and testers.
Act as a key liaison between scrum teams, business stakeholders, and external suppliers.
Support DevOps practices, including continuous improvements and issue resolution.




Skills and Experience




Technical Skills

Proven experience in Information and Data Analysis, including validating and comparing system outputs (e.g., tax sheets, broker commissions).
Strong ability to gather, organize, and analyze data to identify trends, discrepancies, and solutions.
Familiarity with Policy Administration Systems and financial data flows (preferred).
Proficiency in working with large datasets and reporting tools.




Professional Competencies

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent data validation, troubleshooting, and documentation capabilities.
Good communication skills to translate technical findings into business-friendly insights.
Ability to work in Agile/DevOps environments with cross-functional teams.




Key Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in IT, Business Analysis, or a related field.
5+ years of experience as an Information or Data Analyst.
Proficiency in data gathering, validation, and analysis techniques.
Strong communication skills in English & DUTCH (spoken and written).

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities


Prepare Data & Analytics activities (analysis and data architecture) for building and rolling out D&A solutions so that the business gets operational, tactical and strategic insights that can be used for fact-based decisions/actions or to learn and in that way realize the business strategy & objectives
Perform Data analyses, build and execute D&A solutions, set up data structures for further use
Act as coach & change agent to let the company evolve into an Insight Driven Organisation
Support data projects for delivering data to be able to successfully execute their activities


Specific skills


At least 3 year demonstrable experience as a Data Analyst in a similar environment
At least 1.5 year demonstrable experience with business/functional analysis
Strong technical acumen (being able to quickly pick up new technical things, ....)
At least 5 years - data expertise (data architecture, data products, AI, ...)
Strong knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau or Power BI)
