Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij geïnteresseerd in data en data-analyse? Heb jij een sterk analytisch vermogen en hou je ervan om zorgvuldig te werken? Dan ben jij misschien dé data analist die wij bij het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare Werken nodig hebben!




De functie focust enerzijds op het verzamelen, verwerken en het visualiseren van data in verband met openbare infrastructuur zoals wegen, fietspaden, bruggen, tunnels, sluizen e.a. en investeringen voor de bouw, het onderhoud, de herstelling, de aanpassing en de verwijdering van dit soort constructies.




Het gaat meer in het bijzonder om:

het verzamelen en controleren van technische en economische datasets in functie van nuttige inzichten, trends en indicatoren;
het verwerken van deze datasets, zoals het opschonen van data, het samenbrengen van datasets en het transformeren van data;
het visualiseren van data door middel van rapporten en dashboards;
het doorsturen van data naar andere applicaties en platformen voor verder gebruik;
het publiceren van rapporten en dashboards;
het beheren van rapporten en dashboards, zoals het monitoren van hun correct functioneren en van de nauwkeurigheid.




Anderzijds werkt de functie mee aan het analyseren van datasets: bouwtechnische en economische data worden hierbij gecombineerd om kengetallen en modellen te creëren zodat projecten voor het bouwen, onderhouden, herstellen, aanpassen en verwijderen van openbare infrastructuur sneller en meer accuraat kunnen geraamd worden. In deze functie is het de bedoeling om inzicht te verwerven in de beschikbare data, deze op een oordeelkundige manier samen te brengen, een ruim aanbod aan kengetallen en modellen ten behoeve van investeringsplannen te ontwikkelen en dit aanbod continu up-to-date te houden en te verbeteren.




Kom jij het team versterken?

Je beschikt minstens over een bachelordiploma.
Je hebt 1-3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie (data analyst, reporting analyst, researcher). Je hebt praktische ervaring van o.a. Microsoft Excel (Power Query – Power Pivot) en Power BI.
Je beschikt over uitstekende praktische ICT-vaardigheden.
Je gaat vlot om met digitale toepassingen (o.a. webapplicaties).
Je kan goed aan de slag met de applicaties van Microsoft Office 365.
Je hebt goede kritische analytische vaardigheden en je bent nieuwsgierig en toegewijd om problemen op te lossen en verbanden te leggen of oorzaken te zien.
Je hebt een sterke wiskundige basis (statistiek, modellering) en interesse in data-analyse en modellering.
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van het Nederlands.

Pluspunten

Je hebt kennis van R en/of Python of basiskennis van Matlab, VB.NET of aanverwante software)




Werken via Vlaanderen Connect

Je wordt tewerkgesteld via Vlaanderen Connect, de ICT strategische dienstverlener van de Vlaamse overheid. Bij Vlaanderen Connect. wordt je voor onbepaalde duur ter beschikking gesteld aan het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare werken, hierbij ontvang je een contract van onbepaalde duur.

Werken voor Vlaanderen Connect. betekent werken in een organisatie met boeiende en uitdagende IT functies én de mogelijkheid om mee je schouders te zetten in het uitbouwen van een digitaal en slagkrachtig Vlaanderen.




Verder biedt werken voor Vlaanderen Connect tal van voordelen. Je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je meewerken aan een digitale en slagkrachtige overheid, voor burgers en ondernemers. Daarnaast kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen Connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Aanbod

Vlaanderen connect biedt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief salarispakket met:

een mobiliteitsbudget
maaltijdcheques van 8 euro/dag (eigen bijdrage 1,09 euro/dag)
een hospitalisatieverzekering (je kan gezinsleden aansluiten)
een groepsverzekering
mogelijkheid tot kinderopvang tijdens alle schoolvakanties aan een voordelig tarief.




Bij Vlaanderen connect is een gezonde balans tussen werk en privé belangrijk: een werkweek van 38 uur, 28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11, 15/11 en 26/12). Verder zijn er flexibele werkuren en je kan thuiswerken.




Ten slotte krijg je bij Vlaanderen connect nog verschillende andere voordelen: je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Overtuigd?!

Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatieknop!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Senior (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT, de l’ingénierie et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans, notamment en 2024 où les Extiens se hissent à la première place du palmarès Best Workplaces France !

Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay
Show more

Title: Data analyst - business
Description:
About the Role
We are seeking data-driven individuals with a strong foundation in SQL and a sharp understanding of data flows. This role is not only about technical skills; it also requires a business mindset. You'll need to see the big picture and connect your work to business strategies while adapting to various banking products.

As part of a collaborative team, you'll work across multiple tribes, with flexibility in assignments depending on your expertise. Your ability to align with strategic goals and adapt to new challenges is just as important as your technical skills.

What You'll Do

Conduct data analysis to uncover insights and support decision-making.
Use SQL to manage, query, and manipulate data.
Understand and map data flows across systems and processes.
Collaborate with the team to align data insights with business strategies.
Adapt to different banking products and their specific data requirements.

What We're Looking For
Must-Have Skills:

Proficiency in SQL
Experience in data analysis and managing data flows

Nice-to-Have Skills:

Knowledge of Cognos
Experience in the banking sector is a plus but not required
Familiarity with machine learning is optional, but not a primary focus for this role

Mindset Matters:
We value candidates with a business-oriented mindset who can think strategically, adapt to challenges, and work well in a team. While technical expertise is important, your approach and flexibility will make all the difference.

Why Join Us?

Opportunity to collaborate across multiple tribes with room for growth
Work in an innovative, dynamic environment that leverages data for strategic insights
Show more

HTML:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT, de l’ingénierie et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans, notamment en 2024 où les Extiens se hissent à la première place du palmarès Best Workplaces France !

Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay

Title: Data Analyst Finance

Are you passionate about transforming data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions? We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst Finance to join our team and help shape the future of financial reporting and analytics. You will play a key role in collecting and analyzing data from various sources, creating interactive dashboards, and providing actionable insights to our Finance department and beyond.




As a Data Analyst in Finance, you will help the team navigate large datasets, build impactful Power BI reports, and support data-driven decision-making within the organization. You'll also act as a key liaison between the Finance department and other teams to ensure the smooth execution of digital transformation projects.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Je komt terecht in de marketing tribe bij Telenet Business, de dynamische en groeiende B2B-circle binnen de Telenet groep. Nu B2B steeds meer datagedreven wordt, speel jij een cruciale rol in het overnemen van deze mindset en het verschaffen van de juiste inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van een klein dynamisch team dat verantwoordelijk is voor marketing intelligence, marketing automation, digital marketing en performance. De data analist werkt zeer nauw samen met de marketing collega's, zijn data analist collega's, data scientists maar ook met sales, solutions experts, business analisten.

Jouw rol als data analist


Als data analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheersen van commerciële data, zorg je ervoor dat deze door jou of andere collega's wordt opgeschoond en ondersteun je stakeholders met interessante business inzichten. Als je houdt van een verscheidenheid aan dataprojecten, in een complex datalandschap en om samen te werken met een veelheid aan stakeholders, dan ben jij onze persoon!
Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
Stuur het commerciële team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te definiëren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
Creëer in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerciële sturing.
Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.


We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden


Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels is essentieel, Frans is een plus.
Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.


Wat kun je van ons verwachten?


Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé.
Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken

Title: Accounting Data Analyst
Description:
Gentis is a Belgian recruitment company headquartered in Brussels and providing permanent staffing as well as project sourcing solutions worldwide in multiple sectors.




For our client an company based in the surroundings of Brussels, we are looking for an Accounting Data Analyst in the Financial Services sector.




Tasks:




Performing in-depth data analyses (inventories, balances, reconciliations]
Modelling new process steps in Standard Operating Procedures (including process flows & service levels agreement)
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy, quality and adherence to established standards for the purpose of data migrations
Preparing and presenting comprehensive reports and data visualizations to stakeholders, providing insights that drive decision making




Requirements:




Knowledge in Banking and Asset Management with strong focus on Accounting
Proven experience in Data Analysis and Process Modelling, including strong expertise in data crunching and process modelling techniques
Fluent in English, French and/or Dutch are great assets
Solid organizational autonomy and multi-tasking skills




If you are interested or willing to know more, feel free to reach out or to apply :




☎ : +32 492 11 28 03

💻 : maxime.j@gentis.com

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📊 Breng data tot leven en maak impact!




Wil jij de spil zijn in het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen binnen een innovatieve organisatie? 🌟 Als Data Analyst krijg jij de kans om data om te toveren tot krachtige inzichten die onze business naar een hoger niveau tillen. Dit is jouw kans om jouw analytische scherpte, technische vaardigheden en talent voor communicatie in te zetten en écht het verschil te maken. 💡




Als Data Analyst ben je onmisbaar in onze organisatie. Jij:




Implementeert geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagementoplossingen die het gebruik van data en rapportages optimaliseren. 📈
Visualiseert data met tools zoals Tableau of Power BI en vertaalt complexe data naar begrijpelijke inzichten. 📊
Analyseert en modelleert data om waardevolle inzichten te leveren voor strategische keuzes. 📚
Waarborgt de kwaliteit van onze data door middel van testing en het opstellen van een data quality beleid. ✅
Adviseert en ondersteunt de organisatie bij het maken van data-gedreven beslissingen. 🧠
Stimuleert innovatie door het toepassen van AI en Machine Learning in onze rapportage- en analyseprocessen. 🤖




Waarmee kan jij ons team versterken?

Je bent analytisch sterk en hebt ervaring met datavisualisatietools (zoals Tableau of Power BI). 💻
Je hebt kennis van data-analyse en -modellering en bent bekend met AI en Machine Learning.
Je bent communicatief vaardig en kunt complexe inzichten vertalen naar begrijpelijke taal voor stakeholders. ✨
Je bent proactief, innovatief en gedreven om het beste uit data te halen. 🔍
Je kan je vlot uitdrukken in het Nederlands, Frans en Engels.
Je hebt kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira.




What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.




We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.




Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, bonus, vergoedingen, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Show more

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Description de Poste : Analyste Qualité des Données (Secteur de l'Énergie)

Lieu : Gosselies




Contexte

Ce poste soutient la transition du secteur de l'énergie vers une gestion axée sur les données, avec un focus sur :

Analytics : Rapports stratégiques et tableaux de bord KPI.
Gouvernance des Données : Mise en place de politiques de gestion des données.
Qualité des Données : Amélioration de l'exactitude, complétude et cohérence des données.

L'Analyste contribuera à la qualité des données via des actions proactives et correctives.




Responsabilités :

Analyse des Données : Comprendre le paysage des données, documenter structures et anomalies.
Qualité des Données : Définir des règles, identifier les causes des anomalies, proposer des solutions.
Suivi et Reporting : Suivre les KPI, détecter les anomalies, générer des rapports.
Documentation : Centraliser les règles, partager recommandations et solutions.
Promotion de la Qualité : Sensibiliser les équipes.
Outils et Automatisation : Utiliser Python, Power BI, Atacama DQ, et développer des solutions automatisées.




Profil Recherché :

Formation : Diplôme en informatique, data ou équivalent.
Expérience : 2 à 5 ans en qualité des données (secteur énergie, un plus).
Compétences :
Compréhension métier-données.
Autonomie et bonne communication.
Résolution pragmatique et curiosité technologique.
Techniques : Python, MS Excel, Power BI, et Atacama DQ

Show more
HTML:
Description de Poste : Analyste Qualité des Données (Secteur de l'Énergie)

Lieu : Gosselies


Contexte

Ce poste soutient la transition du secteur de l'énergie vers une gestion axée sur les données, avec un focus sur :

  • Analytics : Rapports stratégiques et tableaux de bord KPI.
  • Gouvernance des Données : Mise en place de politiques de gestion des données.
  • Qualité des Données : Amélioration de l'exactitude, complétude et cohérence des données.

L'Analyste contribuera à la qualité des données via des actions proactives et correctives.


Responsabilités :

  • Analyse des Données : Comprendre le paysage des données, documenter structures et anomalies.
  • Qualité des Données : Définir des règles, identifier les causes des anomalies, proposer des solutions.
  • Suivi et Reporting : Suivre les KPI, détecter les anomalies, générer des rapports.
  • Documentation : Centraliser les règles, partager recommandations et solutions.
  • Promotion de la Qualité : Sensibiliser les équipes.
  • Outils et Automatisation : Utiliser Python, Power BI, Atacama DQ, et développer des solutions automatisées.


Profil Recherché :

  • Formation : Diplôme en informatique, data ou équivalent.
  • Expérience : 2 à 5 ans en qualité des données (secteur énergie, un plus).
  • Compétences :
  • Compréhension métier-données.
  • Autonomie et bonne communication.
  • Résolution pragmatique et curiosité technologique.
  • Techniques : Python, MS Excel, Power BI, et Atacama DQ

Title: Industrial Data Analyst
Description:
Wil jij werken bij een snelgroeiend techbedrijf en leider in innovatie? Bij I-care Group maak je deel uit van een dynamisch team dat wereldwijd een positieve impact heeft. Onze datagestuurde oplossingen maken industrieën productiever, veiliger en duurzamer. Met meer dan 800 technici en ingenieurs in 26 kantoren monitoren we wereldwijd dagelijks meer dan 300.000 machines. Wil jij continu leren en verantwoordelijkheid nemen in een stimulerende omgeving? We zoeken een enthousiaste Data Analyst voor ons online monitoring team in Mechelen. 

Functieomschrijving:

Ben jij een gepassioneerde en ambitieuze ingenieur met grote interesse in Data Analyse? Dan is deze rol op jouw lijf geschreven. Je krijgt de kans om geavanceerde predictieve onderhoudsprogramma's te ontwikkelen, te implementeren en te beheren voor onze klanten. Je duikt diep in de wereld van trillingsdata, waar je gebruikmaakt van de nieuwste Artificial Intelligence (AI) en draadloze systemen om potentiële storingen en defecten in industriële apparatuur en machines te voorspellen. En het beste van alles? Bij I-care investeren we in jouw groei en bieden we een uitgebreide interne opleiding, zodat je een echte specialist kunt worden en het verschil kunt maken voor onze klanten.

Wat worden jouw verantwoordelijkheden? 

Bij I-care draait het om Lifelong Learning. Elke dag krijg je de kans om je kennis en vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen en bij te dragen aan innovatieve oplossingen voor industriële uitdagingen.
Met jouw expertise in trillingsanalyse speel je een cruciale rol in het vroegtijdig detecteren van potentiële storingen en defecten in machines, waardoor kostbare stilstand en reparaties worden voorkomen.
Door proactief onderhoud op basis van jouw analyse kunnen bedrijven hun operationele activiteiten optimaliseren en de betrouwbaarheid en productiviteit van hun installaties verhogen.
Je draagt niet alleen bij aan kostenbesparingen voor onze klanten, maar ook aan een veiligere werkomgeving door potentiële storingen en defecten tijdig te identificeren en aan te pakken.

Welk profiel heb je? 

Je bent in het bezit van een bachelor- of masterdiploma in een industrieel technisch, analytisch vakgebied. 
We zoeken iemand met uitstekende analytische vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe problemen op te lossen.
Communicatieve vaardigheden zijn essentieel, aangezien je effectief zult moeten communiceren met diverse belanghebbenden.
Heb je ervaring met trillingsanalyse en het interpreteren van trillingsgegevens? Dat is zeker een pluspunt!
En last but not least: we waarderen zelfstandigheid en proactiviteit enorm. Als jij kansen ziet voor procesverbetering en efficiëntie, dan moedigen we je aan om daar actief naar te streven.

Wat heeft I-care jou te bieden? 

Een open en eerlijke omgeving, waar medewerkers daadwerkelijk gewaardeerd worden om hun interesses, passie en betrokkenheid.
Een individueel groei- en leerplan dat past bij jouw interesses en waar zowel werknemer als werkgever baat bij hebben.
De mogelijkheid om intern begeleid en gecoacht te worden om je horizon te verruimen en kennis en vaardigheden op te doen in een werknemersvriendelijke omgeving.
Een aantrekkelijk en volledig verloningspakket in functie van je competenties en ervaring (Firmawagen, groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, dagvergoeding, gsm-vergoeding, internet at home, anciënniteitsdagen, ADV-dagen, flexibele werkuren, bonusregeling, cafetariaplan,...)
Je beste werkdag ooit!


Bij I-care geloven we dat iedereen iets anders en waardevols te bieden heeft om ons sterker te maken als groep en als mensen. Wij waarderen onze mensen om wie ze zijn en behandelen onze medewerkers gelijk ongeacht demografische factoren zoals leeftijd, geslacht, etniciteit, seksuele geaardheid, geloofsovertuiging of handicap.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
I am currently searching for an experience Business Intelligence Specialist for a valued client of mine based with Brussels.




In this role, you will develop and deliver data-driven insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization. As a BI Specialist, you will collaborate with various departments, creating impactful reports and dashboards that enable efficient data analysis and help drive business success.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics.
Gather, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to provide actionable insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency.
Optimize data visualization and reporting processes to improve efficiency.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to inform decision-making and improve business performance.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Specialist (freelance experience preferred).
Strong knowledge of BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Proficiency in SQL and data modeling, with experience in ETL processes.
Familiarity with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery).
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.




Fluent in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexible work arrangements with remote work options.
Opportunity to work on diverse projects in a supportive and innovative team.
Access to cutting-edge tools and data technologies.




If you are interested in this role, Please Apply Now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Publication date: October 29, 2024

Brussels

Contract open-end

The generation department of Luminus plays a critical role in Belgium's energy landscape, with a production capacity of 2135MW. Ensuring the uptime and high performance of our power plants hinges on the quality and accessibility of our data. As we continue to expand our data-driven initiatives, we are strengthening our Generation Data Science team. This transversal team supports both thermal and wind domain experts, working closely with those on the plant floor: maintenance engineers, performance engineers, and operators. We seek a Senior Data Analyst who is passionate about data governance and has a deep understanding of how data can be transformed into actionable insights that drive operational excellence.

Your daily job


Data Governance Champion: You ensure data quality, consistency, and accessibility across the generation department. You develop and implement data governance policies, standards, and processes.
Data Steward: You function as a liaison between IT, engineers, operators, and data scientists. You advocate for data quality and accuracy.
Data Understanding: You develop a deep understanding of the meaning and context of our operational data. You translate complex technical data into understandable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration: You work closely with engineers and operators on the ground to identify their data needs, gather feedback, and ensure that data solutions align with real-world operational challenges.
Data Visualization & Analysis: You leverage your expertise in SQL, data visualization tools (like Qlik), and data modeling techniques to create insightful reports and dashboards. You uncover trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.


Your Profile


You have a strong desire to immerse yourself in the intricacies of electricity production and the unique challenges it presents.
You are strongly committed to data quality, integrity, and governance principles.
You bring over 5 years of proven experience in data analysis, preferably in an industrial or operational setting.
You possess advanced proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating data.
You are skilled in using data visualization tools to create clear and impactful reports and dashboards (experience with Qlik is a plus).
You are familiar with data modeling techniques to structure and organize data effectively.
You can explain complex concepts to anyone in English and French/Dutch.


Appreciated


You have experience using DBT (Data Build Tool) for data transformation and modeling.
You are familiar with version control systems like Git for collaboration and change tracking.
You have experience implementing data product thinking and data mesh concepts in practice.
You are familiar with the unique data challenges within the energy sector.
You have experience working with historians such as Aveva OSIsoft PI.


WHY Join us?

You'll be an integral part of a team that is driving data-driven decision-making in the energy industry. Your work will directly impact the reliability, efficiency, and performance of our power plants. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and a culture that values collaboration, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning.

Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Big Data Engineer

Duration: 13 months (full time)

Location: Brussels

Languages: Dutch, French, English




Job Description:

As a data engineer you will be in charge of understanding and translating the business and functional requirements into technical specifications, collaborate in the definition of the data model (logical and physical) and implement an efficient data solution using the Microsoft on-prem stack (SQL Server / SSIS / SSAS) and Azure data bricks (Delta Lake, Python, Apache Spark).




Roles & Responsibilities:

Translate business, functional and data architectural requirements provided by the Data Functional Analyst and the Data Architect into technical specifications.
Design, build, deploy and maintain data solutions (ETL pipeline, database objects, physical and virtual DataMart’s) according to established standards (data processing, data warehouse, data marts) in accordance with the functional and non-functional requirements (performance, data volume).
Test the analytics solution, ensure the data correctness, conduct troubleshooting, provide maintenance and adequate technical documentation.
Works with the Project Leader (PL) along the entire project lifecycle to ensure appropriate delivery in an agile and pragmatic approach.
Integrate referential data into a central data hub.




Key Skills:

Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or equivalent
Experience as a data engineer in the Microsoft BI on-prem stack (Visual Studio, SSIS, SSAS, SSMS)
Experience as a data engineer with Azure data bricks.
Ability to translate business requirements into technical requirements
Data modelling experience (logical and physical modelling)
Good experience in data warehouse design (Kimball dimensional modelling)
Very good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (from a development perspective) and Delta Lake.
Very good Knowledge of SQL queries, T-SQL, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Very good Knowledge of Python (from a data engineer perspective), pandas and Apache Spark.
Very good understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework
Experience in master and reference data integration and usage
Experience in working in an agile project mode.
Experience in building a data validation engine (business rules, semantic validation) is a plus
Experience in visualization tool such as Microsoft Power BI and SSRS is a plus.
Experience in data functional analysis is a plus.

Title: BI & Data Analysis Expert DIGI
Description:
Job Description

At the forefront of the telecom revolution, our mission is to innovate and lead with a customer-centric, data-driven approach. As we evolve from startup to scale-up, we're enhancing our team with a Data Analyst position to support all domains of our organization from our offices in Brussels (and in some occasions in Oostkamp).

The BI & Data Analysis Expert will be crucial in supporting strategic decision-making & customer behavior through ad-hoc analysis and insights. This role is tailored for a professional skilled in translating complex business questions into data-driven solutions using a variety of internal and external data sources.

Your Key Responsibilities as a BI & Data Analysis Expert will include:


Build a data pipeline to collect data from third party applications into SQL databases.
Utilize Python and SQL to conduct comprehensive data analyses, translating business needs into actionable insights.
Create meaningful visuals to illustrate insights.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand and fulfill their data analysis needs.
Employ advanced analytical techniques to model and predict future trends (e.g. sales, finance & inventory forecasting).
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all analyses.


Job requirements

Must Haves Qualities & Talents


Ability to cope with uncertainty and to establish foundations in a context of scaling up, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
Experience using Looker Data Platform (not Looker Studio) is a plus.
Expertise in Python and SQL, with a proven track record in data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical skills, capable of capturing complex requirements and delivering meaningful insights.
Excellent consulting skills, including stakeholder management, effective communication, and the flexibility to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.
At least 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in telecom, ecommerce, consulting or technology industries.
Proficient in English and in Dutch or French.
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and a commitment to providing actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and articulate complex data concepts in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience leveraging digital, logistics, geo spatial, sales, marketing, customer care and/or infrastructure data.
Skills in building data driven automation processes (e.g. module processing inputs & outputting predictions/estimations) is a plus.
Data engineering skills is a plus but can be a differentiator.
Specific experience in building Marketing Campaign & customer behavior insights (linking campaign data, Google Analytics, sales & customer care data) is a huge plus.


What We Offer

At Digi Belgium you will be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in which we greatly value your own input and believe in the growth of each of our employees. We offer you a great opportunity to work for a fast-growing and innovative employer that operates as a challenger in the Belgian telecom market. Next to this, we also offer a wide range of benefits, including:


Dynamic Work Environment: Dive into the bustling world of telecom at our startup! Expect a workplace that thrives on challenges and growth opportunities.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a rewarding package including competitive salary and different interesting benefits
Permanent Contract: Secure your future with us – enjoy the stability of a permanent contract.
Invest in Yourself: We provide ample resources for your personal and professional development. Use our generous budget to level up your skills and become even more awesome.
Contemporary Workspace: Immerse yourself in a cutting-edge office environment where innovation and collaboration reign supreme. Our central locations in Oostkamp and Brussels ensure easy accessibility.
Extra Time Off: Work hard and reap the rewards! Enjoy an extra 12 days off per year for full-time employees, making those 40-hour weeks fly by.


Application Process

Candidates are invited to send their CV along with examples of projects they have worked on by the 6th of September 2024. Be part of our mission to revolutionize the telecom industry, leveraging innovation and data to drive success. The recruitment process will include hands-on business and analytics cases to assess your skills and fit for the role.

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in telecom, ecommerce, consulting or technology industries.
  • Proficient in English and in Dutch or French.
  • Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and a commitment to providing actionable insights.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and articulate complex data concepts in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience leveraging digital, logistics, geo spatial, sales, marketing, customer care and/or infrastructure data.
  • Skills in building data driven automation processes (e.g. module processing inputs & outputting predictions/estimations) is a plus.
  • Data engineering skills is a plus but can be a differentiator.
  • Specific experience in building Marketing Campaign & customer behavior insights (linking campaign data, Google Analytics, sales & customer care data) is a huge plus.

What We Offer

At Digi Belgium you will be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in which we greatly value your own input and believe in the growth of each of our employees. We offer you a great opportunity to work for a fast-growing and innovative employer that operates as a challenger in the Belgian telecom market. Next to this, we also offer a wide range of benefits, including:

  • Dynamic Work Environment: Dive into the bustling world of telecom at our startup! Expect a workplace that thrives on challenges and growth opportunities.
  • Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a rewarding package including competitive salary and different interesting benefits
  • Permanent Contract: Secure your future with us – enjoy the stability of a permanent contract.
  • Invest in Yourself: We provide ample resources for your personal and professional development. Use our generous budget to level up your skills and become even more awesome.
  • Contemporary Workspace: Immerse yourself in a cutting-edge office environment where innovation and collaboration reign supreme. Our central locations in Oostkamp and Brussels ensure easy accessibility.
  • Extra Time Off: Work hard and reap the rewards! Enjoy an extra 12 days off per year for full-time employees, making those 40-hour weeks fly by.

Application Process

Candidates are invited to send their CV along with examples of projects they have worked on by the 6th of September 2024. Be part of our mission to revolutionize the telecom industry, leveraging innovation and data to drive success. The recruitment process will include hands-on business and analytics cases to assess your skills and fit for the role.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
🌟 Freelance Opportunity: Data Engineer 🌟




📍 Location: EU - Remote




Are you a Data Engineering expert with a passion for enabling data-driven growth? Join the world’s largest jewellery brand and make a real impact! We're on the hunt for a talented Data Engineer to design, build, and maintain the data infrastructure powering our analytics and machine learning initiatives.




Your Role

As a Data Engineer in our Marketing Analytics Engineering team, you'll:

Develop and maintain data products and pipelines in Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Optimize data pipelines for performance, scalability, and efficiency, supporting global insights.
Ensure data integrity with robust validation, cleansing, and error-handling processes.
Partner with cross-functional teams to enhance our data infrastructure and drive impactful results.

What You’ll Bring

Technical Expertise

4+ years as a Data Engineer, ETL Developer, or similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and Spark SQL.
Experience with Azure Synapse Analytics, Databricks, and the Microsoft Azure Stack.
Expertise in Apache Spark using PySpark.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Git, and DevOps workflows.
Knowledge of dimensional data modeling and streaming data ingestion processes.
Proficiency in Python.
Bonus: Experience in the retail industry or marketing analytics.

Soft Skills

Problem-solving mindset with an analytical approach.
Exceptional communication skills—able to translate technical concepts into business-friendly terms.
A team player who thrives in collaborative environments.
Detail-oriented, with a commitment to high-quality data solutions.

Why Join Us?

Be part of a globally recognized brand.
Work on exciting, cutting-edge projects that drive data-driven decisions.
Collaborate with a diverse and talented team across the globe.

Ready to Shine?

If you're passionate about data engineering and eager to make a difference, we want to hear from you!

📩 Apply now by sending your CV and availability to andrea1@senovo-it.com

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Job Description



We are looking for a Junior, Medior and Senior Power BI Consultants who will join a key player in the R&D sector.

Manage Power BI data and dashboards.

Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future.

With 25 years’ experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, business consultants, solution architects, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the world’s leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels. 

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

  • Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?
  1. Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
  2. Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
  3. Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
  4. Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
  5. Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
  6. Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
  7. Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
  8. Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
  9. Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description du poste et Missions

Les raisons de rejoindre AFD.Tech part of Accenture, et tous nos avantages :


Bénéficiez d’un accompagnement personnalisé dès votre 1er jour d’arrivée par nos Talent Managers et votre futur Manager (accueil au siège d’Accenture ou en agence en régions, journée d’onboarding, petit-déjeuner convivial)
Développez vos compétences techniques, fonctionnelles ou de management, grâce au catalogue de formations Accenture et à l’aide de nos Practice Managers et de leurs communautés
Faîtes évoluer votre carrière grâce à notre politique de mobilité
Une team E-sports engagée sur League Of Legend en Ligue Corpo Riot X Vitality, coachée par Yellowstar
Vivez des expériences hors du commun avec des événements réguliers


Nos recrutements sont fondés sur les compétences, sans distinction d’origine, d’âge, ou de genre et tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

A très bientôt chez AFD.Tech part of Accenture !

Profil recherché

Responsabilités :


Collecte et préparation des données
Collecter, nettoyer et structurer les données issues de différentes sources (bases de données internes, API, fichiers externes, etc.).
Vérifier la qualité des données et effectuer des corrections si nécessaire.
Créer et maintenir des pipelines de données pour garantir la disponibilité des données nécessaires à l’analyse.
Analyse des données
Analyser les données à l’aide d’outils statistiques et de techniques de modélisation (régressions, clustering, séries temporelles, etc.).
Identifier des tendances, des patterns, et des insights utiles pour améliorer la prise de décision.
Fournir des recommandations basées sur les résultats des analyses.
Visualisation des données
Concevoir des rapports et des tableaux de bord interactifs et clairs, en utilisant des outils comme Power BI, Tableau, ou Excel.
Communiquer les résultats de manière compréhensible pour les non-spécialistes, avec des visualisations adaptées.
Collaboration et communication
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers (marketing, finance, opération, etc.) pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données.
Présenter les résultats des analyses aux équipes et à la direction.
Accompagner les équipes dans l’interprétation des données et la mise en œuvre des recommandations.
Veille technologique et amélioration continue
Suivre les évolutions technologiques et méthodologiques dans le domaine de la data science et de l’analyse de données.
Proposer des améliorations ou de nouvelles approches pour optimiser les processus de collecte et d’analyse de données.


Compétences requises :


Compétences techniques :
Maîtrise des outils d’analyse de données (Excel, SQL, Python, R, etc.).
Connaissance des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Solides connaissances en statistiques et en modélisation de données.
Compréhension des bases de données relationnelles et non relationnelles.
Compétences analytiques :
Capacité à analyser et à interpréter des données complexes.
Aptitude à identifier des tendances et à en tirer des conclusions pertinentes.
Rigueur et précision dans le traitement des données.
Compétences interpersonnelles :
Bonnes capacités de communication pour présenter des résultats à des non-experts.
Esprit d’équipe et capacité à collaborer avec différentes parties prenantes.
Sens de l’écoute et capacité à comprendre les besoins métiers.


Informations utiles


Localisation Bruxelles, Belgique - pas de déplacement
Contrat CDI
Salaire 38000,00 à 50000,00 EUR par an
Niveau de qualification Ingénieur/Cadre/Bac +5
Expérience 1 à 7 ans
Modalités de travail Temps complet
Fonction Informatique - Systèmes d'Information
Secteur Secteur informatique/ESN
Télétravail Partiel


Formation et expériences :


Formation Bac +5 en Data Science, Informatique, Mathématiques, Statistiques, ou domaine équivalent.
Expérience : 2 ans d'éxpériences minimum
Langues : Français/ Néerlandais et Anglais


Rémunération : À définir selon l’expérience et le profil.

Qui sommes nous ?

AFD.TECH Paris


France


AFD.TECH part of Accenture, spécialiste du conseil en IT et Télécommunications, a rejoint le groupe Accenture en 2022. Accenture est le Leader mondial des services aux entreprises et administrations, avec une expertise de pointe dans les domaines du numérique, du cloud, et de la sécurité. C’est aussi une communauté de plus de 730 000 talents et une mission commune : réaliser la promesse technologique alliée à l’ingéniosité humaine.

En 2024, AFD.Tech, filiale d’Accenture, regroupe plus de 2000 talents répartis dans 3 pays (France, Belgique et Maroc), pour un chiffre d’affaires annuel de plus de 130M€.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Manuport Logistics offers a unique mix of logistics services in all kinds of transport modes: sea, inland waterways, road, rail and air transport. With our headquarters in the port of Antwerp we have an international network of offices worldwide: Piraeus, Valencia, Madrid, Barcelona, Miami, Hamburg, Brazil, Singapore, etc.

MPL is a fast-growing logistic partner, where the ability to change, customer focus, flexibility and innovation are always in top of mind. We try to actively stimulate entrepreneurship and ownership to develop the best logistics engineers for our customers. Together we face all challenges within a 'BE Different - BE MPL' team. For the further growth we are currently looking for a:




Business Intelligence Analyst




POSITION

At Manuport Logistics we are looking for an experienced and passionate hands on BI Analyst to join our team, focusing on helping businesses leverage data for actionable results.




Engage closely with business users to deeply understand their unique business needs and challenges.
Analyze and translate complex business questions into clear, actionable semantic models, primarily for MS PowerBI.
Develop and maintain data models and reports that help solve critical business issues.
Collaborate with customers to provide tailored solutions that add measurable value.
Create, manage, and optimize MS PowerBI dashboards and reports that provide deep insights and drive business decisions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Data & AI technologies and continuously improve our BI offerings.
Serve as a BI expert, guiding both internal teams and clients on best practices for data visualization and reporting.




PROFILE

Minimum of 3 years of relevant hands-on experience in BI, with strong expertise in PowerBI, data modeling, and semantic model development leveraging MS Fabric.
Experience working in Logistics or Finance & Operations industries is a plus
Proven ability to work closely with business users, translating their requirements into technical models and reports.
Strong understanding of BI best practices, with a track record of delivering high-quality insights that drive business impact.
Passion for Data & AI technologies, and an eagerness to stay current with industry trends.
Fluent in Dutch and English, with excellent communication skills to effectively interact with Flemish customers.




BE DIFFERENT, BE MPL

MPL is proud to be different. We challenge one another to be the best version of ourselves. We look for creative solutions in the professional transporting of customers’ goods from A to B. We always work as a team, valuing every one of our team members. Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm. We provide a professional and international working environment. We offer the perfect candidate a competitive salary and opportunities for further development within the MPL Group.

Winners find a reason, losers an excuse. Are you a winner? Then send your application to careers@manuport-logistics.be and we’ll be in touch.

Title: Data Analytics Study & Internship
Description:
Refonte Infini is a leading IT corporation globally recognized for its expertise in providing top-notch IT and Ed-tech services. Specializing in Artificial intelligence (AI), digital marketing, data science, data analytics, UI-UX design, web development, and app development, we are dedicated to innovation, excellence, and empowering talents worldwide.




Job Summary:




Refonte Technology is offering a chance for eager individuals seeking to master Data Analytics from basic to advanced levels, all while engaging in real-world projects across the globe. Our program is structured to provide a flexible work setting, allowing participants to collaborate with a diverse global team spanning Oceania, Asia, Europe, and the Americas.




Projects You Will Work On:




Excel project: Visualize hospital dataset using Excel

Statistical project: Analyze live stock price data to study company stock behavior.

EDA case study: Apply EDA techniques in risk analytics for minimizing lending risk.

Bike-sharing system analysis: Examine bike-sharing data and usage patterns.

IPL data analysis: Analyze data from the Indian Premier League cricket tournament.

Data findings communication: Present summarized results and key insights from projects.

Global movie release: Plan to release a movie globally in 2024 by RSVP Movies.




Roles & Responsibilities:

- Collaborate with our esteemed data science experts to collect, clean, and analyze extensive datasets, honing skills in data preprocessing and visualization.

- Utilize machine learning and data mining techniques to extract insights from large datasets, including Excel interface structure identification. ·

- Apply Python programming skills for Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) in real business scenarios, focusing on risk analytics in banking and financial services. ·

- Design scientific tests and optimize model performance using the latest modeling technologies like no-code databases and data mining.

- Collaborate with a team of experts to build machine learning pipelines for diverse use cases in commerce, financial markets, and procurement.

- Work with internal stakeholders to explore and understand business data, formulate hypotheses, and measure the impact of strategies using techniques like T-tests.

-Solve specific challenges and develop innovative solutions by adapting modeling technologies like bike share systems.

-Learn and apply complex analytical techniques using tools like Tableau.

- Prepare reports and presentations to effectively communicate data analysis processes and results.




Qualifications:

- Currently pursuing any degree showcasing a strong commitment to continuous learning and professional growth.

- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, vital for effective collaboration and articulation of complex ideas.

- Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a cohesive team, highlighting adaptability and strong teamwork capabilities.




Note:




This position is part of our unpaid “Data Analytics Training and Intern” under Refonte Technology. Upon application, our team will contact you to proceed with the application details and joining process.




Location:

Remote: United States







#DataEngineering #DataArchitecture #BigData #ETL #DataWarehousing #Training #Internship #CareerDevelopment #TechCareers #DataIntegration




---

Title: Freelance Data Engineer / Analyst
Description:
We are searching for Freelance Data Engineers & Data Analysts (Power BI) to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




Data Analyst / Power BI

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.
You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).




Data Engineer

You have a bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have at least 3 years of experience with different data consumption techniques from traditional to more advanced analytics and AI perspective. (Power BI, Tableau, Machine Learning, …)
Power BI means more to you than shiny graphs (and pie charts).
You are willing to dig deep into Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake or Databricks.
You have experience in Azure Data Factory and Data Modelling techniques
You are fluent in SQL & Python.
You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).




OUR OFFER

Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Solver - Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI.




At Exsolvæ, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our expert team and help our clients unlock the power of data to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.




Your Role:

As a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist, you will design and implement data-driven solutions that enable organizations to make informed, strategic decisions. You will work alongside multidisciplinary teams, using advanced BI tools and techniques to create insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics workflows.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their analytical needs and recommend BI solutions that align with their strategic goals.
Data Integration and Reporting: Design and implement data visualization solutions using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, creating impactful dashboards and reports.
Data Ecosystem Implementation: Build and optimize scalable data pipelines to process and transform data efficiently for BI and analytics purposes.




Technical Implementation

Data Modeling: Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models to support analytical needs.
ETL/ELT Development: Create efficient data integration workflows using ETL/ELT tools and frameworks.
Advanced Analytics: Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
Cloud BI Solutions: Deploy and manage BI workflows on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud to ensure performance and scalability.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in BI and analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies.
Explore innovative ways to integrate advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive analytics and machine learning, into BI solutions.




Project Management

Lead BI and analytics projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet client objectives.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams with BI and analytics capabilities.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, and strong SQL skills for querying databases.
Data Integration Skills: Experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Informatica.
Cloud Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud BI platforms like Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS QuickSight, or Google BigQuery.
Programming Skills: Familiarity with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
Soft Skills: Strong analytical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills to work with clients and multidisciplinary teams.




Preferred Skills

Knowledge of big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning integration into BI workflows.
Familiarity with KPI frameworks and business acumen to align analytics with strategic goals.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Tableau Certified Professional.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Playson, we’re on a mission to create innovative gaming experiences powered by actionable insights. We’re looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team and help turn complex data into clear, strategic recommendations that drive business growth. If you’re passionate about numbers and want to make a real impact, this role is for you.

What You'll Be Doing


Transform and analyze large, complex data sets representing transactional, financial data, and player behavior to uncover actionable insights.
Deliver proactive recommendations to stakeholders across product, commercial, and technical disciplines to shape optimization and enhance KPIs.
Build and maintain automated dashboards to visualize key metrics and performance trends.
Deliver in-depth researches to check against various business hypotheses and provide actionable recommendations.
Collaborate across teams to drive data-informed decisions for product improvements.
Own multiple data projects in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
Contribute to data literacy growth and advancement across the company.


What You’ll Bring


4+ years of analytical experience, ideally in the iGaming, gaming or video streaming industry.
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying and managing large datasets.
Solid expertise in data visualization, including tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
A proactive data-driven mindset with curiosity, experience in daily reporting, and insights generation.
Excellent communication and data storytelling skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to all stakeholders, regardless of their data skills.
A self-motivated, detail-oriented approach to work.


Nice-to-Have Skills


Familiarity with ClickHouse and Python (or other scripting languages).
Understanding of iGaming market, game provider business model and relevant metrics
Experience with tools like Redash and Confluence.
Enthusiasm for learning and personal projects in data analytics or machine learning.


What We Offer


Competitive salary with quarterly bonuses.
Unlimited paid vacation and sick leave.
Opportunities for professional growth through training programs.

Title: Data Analist RSZ
Description:
Werkgever details

Onze klant is een grote speler in de bouwsector.




Functieomschrijving

Als junior lid van het databeheerteam werk je nauw samen met ICT en andere afdelingen aan projecten binnen de sociale zekerheid.

Je begeleidt de aansluiting van nieuwe fondsen, volgt wijzigingen in datastromen en ontwikkelt nieuwe informatiestromen.

Daarnaast geef je advies aan leden, onderhoud je contacten met partners zoals de Kruispuntbank Sociale Zekerheid (KSZ), en behandel je GDPR-gerelateerde zaken.

Je analyseert technische gegevens, vertaalt complexe informatie naar duidelijke inzichten en draagt bij aan innovaties binnen de sector door deel te nemen aan werkgroepen en samen te werken met verschillende experts.
